forecast.review: Both forecasters surfaced an important constraint I underweighted: the Jan 2025 reinstatement of the debt limit and the likelihood that it remains binding into late June, keeping Total Public Debt Outstanding (TPDO) pinned near the reinstatement level via extraordinary measures. Forecaster 2 also usefully highlighted mid-June quarterly tax receipts dampening late-June net issuance and the practical speed limits on TGA rebuilds and EM unwind. I agree with their path analysis and timing constraints; their narrative clearly favors “No,” though the stated 88% appears to be for No rather than Yes. Forecaster 3 anchored more on deficit run-rate to place TPDO around ~$36T absent a binding ceiling; even so, they concluded only 5% Yes, emphasizing how hard it is to add ~$1T+ in three weeks. I find the ceiling-binding argument persuasive and it meaningfully lowers the plausible starting point relative to my prior, making ≥$37T by June 27 very unlikely without an exceptionally early June debt-limit resolution plus an unusually large and rapid TGA/EM catch-up.
forecast.rationale: Update relative to my prior 30%: With ~23 days left, crossing $37T requires either (a) we are already within ~$100–150B of the threshold, or (b) a debt-limit resolution immediately followed by a very large, very fast EM unwind and TGA rebuild. If the ceiling is binding (base case), the reported TPDO should be near its Jan 2, 2025 level (roughly mid-$35T), making a +$1.5–$2.0T jump by June 27 effectively out of reach. Even if Congress resolves the ceiling in early-to-mid June, historical patterns suggest perhaps ~$0.6–$1.0T of combined EM unwind and TGA rebuild by late June—still short of $37T from a ~mid-$35T starting point. If, contrary to this, the ceiling had already been addressed earlier in 2025 and TPDO is in the high-$36Ts, normal net issuance over three weeks (~$80–150B) could tip it over, but we lack evidence of such a high starting level, and mid-June receipts reduce that likelihood. Weighing these, I substantially lower my probability. I would move back up if we see: (1) an immediate debt-limit suspension with Treasury signaling a very aggressive near-term TGA rebuild (toward ~$1T) and rapid EM restoration, and/or (2) Debt to the Penny prints ≥$36.8–$36.9T by mid-June.
